page.title: 19HOLY TRINITY CHURCH,EXMOUTH
page.content: On Friday 5th July, our class climbed the 100 foot high tower of Holy Trinity Church. Mr. Tuckett, the church warden said that there were 120 spiral steps to climb to reach the top. When we had climbed up 40 steps to the clock room Mr. Tuckett told us some things about the clock. We then had to climb another 80 steps and in doing so passed the bell room. We could not go in there though because it would have been too much of a squash. When we reached the top we were all very tired! We looked through the gaps in the tower and could see for miles. We saw the beach, All Saints Church and our school. We could see right across the Estuary to Dawlish Warren. After we had climbed down again we were feeling quite dizzy, but we all thoroughly enjoyed our visit.
